stories.text:
As a blacksmith I made a physical coin for a village. The coin told the story how the people from the village got their freedom from the centralised Kingdom, here in Spain in 1583.

With the coin I created, people could buy with it on the stores. Tourists bought it as a rememberance. Ended up making thousands.

People sent me photos from the coin around the world.

Now, I'm thinking in making NFTs collection of the photos from the coin around the world and a token with a total supply of the price they paid for their freedom (1.219.512)

Is it worthy? Appreciate your comments.
stories.title: Is it worthy to make a ERC20 token?

stories.text:
Hi there,

we launched capacities.io - your second brain. It's a new note-taking app that solves your problem of organizing all the information you consume every day and turns it to a valuable and growing asset.

In short:

- Capture ideas when you have them: Just send a message to capacities from your favorite messenger and it will be saved to your second brain.

- Organized by type: Don't create faceless pages but define meetings, ideas, questions, or books. Adapt your note-taking to your context and your thinking.

- Say goodbye to folders: An intuitive approach to networked thinking. Don't think about the folder your note should die in before you even start writing. Just start and connect it to all related ideas over time. You will create a highly connected second brain that stays valuable even if you add thousands of notes.

Feel free to try it out, it’s free. Just sign up at capacities.io

And of course we’d love to get your feedback, just reach out at team@capacities.io.
stories.title: Launching a new approach to note-taking / knowledge organization: capacities.io
